function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of mixed-effects model to analyze COVID-19 cases in different cities.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of model results could lead to ineffective disease control measures.","Mitigation":"Thorough validation and testing of the model, and consultation with domain experts in epidemiology.","Technologies":"Statistical software for mixed-effects modeling, visualization tools for model interpretation.","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, policymakers.","Owner":"Statisticians, epidemiologists, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Assumption of independent and identically distributed residuals in the model.","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of model parameters and predictions, leading to ineffective disease control measures.","Mitigation":"Conducting residual analysis, exploring alternative modeling techniques, and consulting with statistical experts.","Technologies":"Statistical software for residual analysis, advanced modeling techniques.","People":"Statisticians, data analysts, epidemiologists.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Multivariate Normal assumption for the distribution of random effects.","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of random effects and biased model predictions, leading to ineffective disease control measures.","Mitigation":"Sensitivity analysis for alternative distributions, validation of assumptions through simulation studies.","Technologies":"Simulation software, statistical validation tools, sensitivity analysis tools.","People":"Statisticians, data analysts, epidemiologists.","Owner":"Research institutions, statistical experts."}]}
